content:
• Tuesday, January 16, 2018
  • EXEL

    Exelixis, Ipsen report cancer drug success in late-stage study

    • Exelixis (NASDAQ:EXEL) +2.5% after-hours after announcing with partner Ipsen (OTCPK:IPSEF, OTCPK:IPSEY) that its cabozantinib cancer drug achieved its primary endpoint in a late-stage study and will be submitted to the FDA before the end of the quarter.
    • The companies say phase 3 Celestial trial results showed the treatment provided a statistically significant and clinically meaningful improvement vs. a placebo in overall survival for patients with advanced hepatocellular carcinoma.
    • The companies say they will present the results at a symposium in San Francisco later this week and hold an investor webcast after the close on Friday.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:35 PM | 20 Comments
  • EGO

    Eldorado Gold reports in-line 2017 gold production, suspends dividend

    • Eldorado Gold (NYSE:EGO) -3.7% after-hours as it reports 2017 gold production in line with revised guidance and suspends its semi-annual dividend payment "pending the results of the technical reports and potential subsequent capital requirements."
    • EGO says full-year gold production totaled nearly 286K oz., including pre-commercial production from Olympias, vs. revised guidance of 280K-310K oz., with all-in sustaining costs expected to come in at ~$900/oz., in-line with revised guidance.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:20 PM | 19 Comments
  • S

    SoftBank boosts Sprint stake again, to 84.7% ownership

    • More purchases of Sprint (NYSE:S) stock by parent SoftBank (OTCPK:SFTBY) have brought its ownership to the brink of its intended limit.
    • Since Nov. 6, SoftBank has bought more than 70.84M shares for $423.35M; that brings its stake in Sprint to 84.7%.
    • That's just shy of an 85% limit that would result in Sprint's delisting, and SoftBank has said it doesn't intend to raise its ownership past that threshold.
    • The conglomerate is also sitting on 54.58M shares of options that it can exercise until July 10.
    • Sprint fell 1.6% during the market session today to land at $5.60; shares are up 0.4% after hours. SoftBank ADRs gained 4.2% today.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:11 PM | 40 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers (1/16/2018)

    • Top gainers: JUNO +44.5%. VRS +10.3%. ADAP +7.9%. CEIX +7.5%. BLUE +7.1%.
    • Top losers: ATEN -22.5%. HIVE -20.1%. XON -6.5%. RNST -5.4%. RPXC -4.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM | 5 Comments
  • JUNO

    WSJ: Celgene in talks to buy Juno Therapeutics

    • Juno Therapeutics (NASDAQ:JUNO) +44.6% after-hours following a WSJ report that Celgene (NASDAQ:CELG) is in talks to buy the company; terms of the potential deal are not known.
    • A deal for Juno would further boost CELG in the market for drugs treating multiple myeloma and other blood cancers, according to the report.
    • The news comes slightly more than a week after CELG agreed to buy closely held Impact Biomedicines.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:21 PM | 121 Comments
  • F

    Ford shares dip as it provides preliminary 2017, 2018 numbers

    • Ford Motor (NYSE:F) shares are quickly slipping postmarket, down 1.5%, after it's issued preliminary 2017 results that fall short of expectations and 2018 guidance on the low side.
    • Speaking at the Deutsche Bank auto conference, the company says preliminary 2017 EPS is $1.78 on an adjusted basis, vs. $1.84 expected by Street analysts. Ford sees unadjusted EPS for 2017 at $1.95.
    • For 2018, it's expecting adjusted EPS of $1.45-$1.70 vs. consensus for $1.59.
    • It's detailing plans to "improve operational fitness, refocus capital allocation and accelerate the introduction of smart vehicles and services.
    • It's announced a regular dividend of $0.15 per share and a $500M supplemental cash dividend ($0.13 per share), for a combined $0.28 per share.
    • Slide presentation
     
     
     
     
    | 5:12 PM | 193 Comments
  • ATEN

    A10 Networks -22% after preliminary Q4 results

    • A10 Networks (NYSE:ATEN) shares are down 22% aftermarket following the release of preliminary Q4 results.
    • A10 expects revenue from $55.5M to $56M, below its prior guidance of $64M to $67M and the consensus estimate of $65.13M. 
    • Non-GAAP EPS expected between $0.05 and $0.06, within the previous guidance of $0.01 to $0.07. Consensus has EPS at $0.03.
    • “We are disappointed with our revenue results for the quarter, which were below our guidance primarily due to a shortfall in North America sales as we experienced lower than expected seasonal demand trends in the region. Despite this shortfall, we increased our cash and cash equivalents by $6.6 million, and continued to see strength for our security solutions," says A10 Networks CEO Lee Chen.     
     
     
     
     
    | 5:02 PM
  • HIVE

    Aerohive slides 20% as preliminary Q4 figures disappoint

    • Aerohive (NYSE:HIVE) has taken a postmarket dive, down 20.2%, after filing preliminary Q4 results below lowest expectations.
    • The company points to sales execution problems that became apparent in the last month.
    • It now expects $37M in net revenue, below Street expectations for $40.5M and the company's own guidance of $40M-$42M. It also sees gross margin (non-GAAP) of 67.5-68.5% (above guidance for 66-67%).
    • It's also seeing positive operating margin and a "modest non-GAAP operating profit." On a GAAP basis, it's expecting a net loss of $3M to $4M.
    • At the end of Q4, cash, equivalents and short-term investments came to $85M.
    • "We have taken actions to replace underperforming sales team members, and we believe that the new people we have been putting in place, combined with other actions, will enable us to capitalize on our improved product offering and exciting roadmap in 2018," says CEO David Flynn.
    • Shares had fallen 3.4% along with the market during the regular session.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM
  • XON

    Intrexon readies stock offering; shares slip 4% after hours

    • Intrexon (NASDAQ:XON) launches a public offering of common stock. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced.
    • Shares are off 4% after hours on modest volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM | 10 Comments
  • PZZA

    Jack in the Box nabs CFO from Papa John's

    • Papa John's International (NASDAQ:PZZA) announces the departure of CFO Lance Tucker.
    • Tucker is leaving the company on March 2 to become the CFO at Jack in the Box (NASDAQ:JACK).
    • The company plans to a search for a replacement immediately.
    • Source: Press Release
    • Shares of Papa John's are down 3.05% in AH trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM | 2 Comments
  • HTGM

    HTG Molecular readies 10M-share stock offering; shares down 23% after hours

    • HTG Molecular Diagnostics (NASDAQ:HTGM) launches a public offering of 10M shares of common stock. Underwriters over-allotment is an additional 1.5M shares. Price and terms have yet to be announced.
    • Shares are down 23% after hours on increased volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM | 12 Comments
  • CLD

    Cloud Peak Energy reaches deal to supply coal to Japan

    • Cloud Peak Energy (NYSE:CLD) +1.9% after hours on news it entered into a coal export sales agreement with Singapore's JERA Trading for two 540 MW power plants being developed by Mitsubishi and Tokyo Electric Power.
    • CLD says coal produced at its Spring Creek mine in Montana, will be carried by rail to Westshore Terminals in Vancouver, for loading onto ocean-going vessels for delivery to two new state-of-the-art IGCC coal-fired power plants in Fukushima, Japan; shipments are expected to begin as soon as the end of 2019 and continue for 30-40 months, reaching up to 1M metric tons in the final contract year.
    • Asian markets have been critical to global coal's rebound, as “the reality is in the U.S. we’re not expecting any significant growth... the one growth opportunity we’ve got are Asian exports," CLD CEO Colin Marshall tells WSJ.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM | 15 Comments
  • ETH

    Lower traffic impacts Ethan Allen

    • Sales at Ethan Allen (NYSE:ETH) came in short in Q4 after retail written orders decreased 5.8%.
    • The retailer reported a gross margin rate of 54.3% and adjusted operating margin rate of 8.7% for the period.
    • CEO update: "Although written orders were impacted by lower traffic and weather-related issues, there was a steady positive momentum during the quarter, with December written orders up from the previous year's levels. Shipments were impacted by several factors including gearing up manufacturing, weather disruption and political challenges in Honduras."
    • ETH -0.71% AH to $27.95.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM
  • GDEN

    Golden Entertainment sets secondary offering for selling shareholders

    • Golden Entertainment (NASDAQ:GDEN) announces a secondary offering of 6.5M shares on behalf of certain shareholders.
    • The company also intends to grant the underwriters a 30-day option to purchase up to another 975K shares directly from Golden at the public offering price.
    • Golden will not receive any proceeds from the share offering.
    • GDEN -1.42% after hours to $31.25.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 7 Comments
  • GNCA

    Genocea Bio initiates equity offering; shares down 12% after hours

    • Genocea Biosciences (NASDAQ:GNCA) launches concurrent public offerings of common stock and Class A warrants. Prices, volumes and terms have yet to be announced.
    • Net proceeds will fund the continued development of GEN-009, working capital and general corporate purposes.
    • Shares are down 12% after hours in increased volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM | 9 Comments
  • NRZ

    New Residential raising capital; down 2.2% after hours

    • The company is  offering 25M shares, with underwriter greenshoe for another 3.75M shares.
    • NRZ -2.2% after hours
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM | 67 Comments
  • LADR

    Big day for Ladder Capital after buyout proposal

    • Related Fund Management this morning proposed $15 per share for all of Ladder Capital (LADR +7.6%).
    • BAML this afternoon upgraded Ladder, saying the Related offer doesn't reflect full value for the stock.
    • Shares closed today at $14.62.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM | 48 Comments
  • BGNE

    BeiGene readies $650M ADS offering; shares down 3% after hours

    • BeiGene (NASDAQ:BGNE) launches a $650M public offering of American Depositary Shares (ADSs), each representing 13 ordinary shares. Price and terms have yet to be announced.
    • Shares are down 3% after hours on light volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • NTNX

    Nutanix will offer $400M senior notes in private placement

    • Nutanix (NASDAQ:NTNX) will offer $400M aggregate principal amount of convertible senior notes due 2023 in a private placement.
    • Initial purchasers will have the option to purchase up to $60M additional notes within a 13-day period of the initial issuance date. 
    • The company will use the net proceeds to pay for convertible note hedge transactions and general corporate purposes.   
    • Nutanix shares are down 1.7% aftermarket.    
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM | 9 Comments
  • CSX

    CSX higher after earnings

    • CSX (NYSE:CSX) says Q4 net earnings included a $3.6B tax reform benefit resulting from the new tax laws and a $10M net restructuring charge.
    • Even after backing out the items, the railroad's company EPS came in ahead of expectations.
    • CSX reports an operating ratio of 60.9% for the quarter after expenses fell 14% Y /Y.
    • Source: Press Release
    • CSX +1.39% in AH trading to $58.95.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM | 5 Comments
  • BMY

    Merck's gain is Bristol-Myers' pain, shares down 5% on Keytruda success in first-line lung cancer

    • Bristol-Myers Squibb (BMY -4.7%) slips on more than double normal volume in reaction to Merck's (MRK +5.9%) announcement positive results from a Phase 3 study of KEYTRUDA (pembrolizumab) in first-line non-squamous non-small lung cancer (NSCLC) ahead of competitor Opdivo (nivolumab).
    • Previously: Merck's Keytruda successful in first-line lung cancer study; shares up 1% premarket (Jan. 16)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM | 15 Comments
  • FOX

    'Jumanji' holds off challengers to box-office lead

    • Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle (SNE -2%) has held its top spot on the box-office charts, solidly outgrossing an action newcomer and the wide release of a newspaper drama.
    • Sony's film drew $35.4M over the four-day holiday weekend, ahead of second-place The Post (FOX -1.2%, FOXA -0.8%), which went nationwide with $23.4M after a limited release, and newcomer The Commuter (LGF.A -4.2%, LGF.B -4.2%), which grossed $16.4M to edge Fox's The Greatest Showman ($15.6M in its fourth week).
    • Jumanji has grossed a cumulative $291.6M domestically and added $385M overseas for a worldwide total of $676.6M. Meanwhile, Star Wars: The Last Jedi (DIS -1.5%) -- in fifth place over the holiday weekend with $15.3M -- has grossed $595.6M domestically and $1.27B worldwide.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM | 15 Comments
  • NVDA

    Chinese automaker will use self-driving platform from Nvidia, Baidu

    • Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) says China’s Chery Automobile Co. will use the ZF ProAI self-driving platform it developed with Baidu (NASDAQ:BIDU) and ZF Friedrichshafen.
    • Last week, Nvidia said that Baidu and ZF selected Nvidia Drive for their self-driving vehicle computing platform development in China.
    • Nvidia shares are down 1%. 
    • Baidu shares are up 2.1%.  
    • Previously: Nvidia rolling out patches for chip security flaw (Jan. 10)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM | 50 Comments
  • ATUS

    CSC Holdings prices $1B in debt for Altice spin-off

    • CSC Holdings (now part of ATUS after its Cablevision takeover) has priced $1B in senior guaranteed notes.
    • The company's offered that amount in notes bearing interest of 5.375%, maturing in 2028.
    • Proceeds are being combined with other resources to refinance existing indebtedness and fund a dividend of $1.5B to Altice USA (ATUS -4%), part of a spin-off of that company from Euro parent Altice (OTCPK:ATCEY).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • RGSE

    RGS Energy moves up after Iroquois hedge fund discloses 6.3% stake

    • RGS Energy (RGSE +3.2%) jumps after Iroquois Capital Management discloses a 6.3% active stake and confirms a cooperation agreement with the company regarding solicitation of proxies in opposition to the election of directors.
    • Iroquois says it will vote in favor of the election of RGSE’s director nominees and approve an increase in the number of shares authorized for issuance and that a participant may receive in a fiscal year.
    • The company also says it completed 2017 with "strong sales growth, achievements and milestones" following its focus on multi-project commercial customers as its commercial sales pipeline rose to $33.9M.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM | 3 Comments
  • RGLXY

    Disney charts new videogame course with four partners

    • Walt Disney (DIS -1.2%) is revamping its videogame strategy, setting up relationships with four new development partners.
    • Each of the four -- Ludia (OTCPK:RGLXY), Glu (GLUU -2.1%), Gameloft (GLOFY -0.7%), and PerBlue -- are working on an unannounced game based on Disney franchises, says the company's Kyle Laughlin.
    • Disney had shut down 250-person Avalanche and its toys-to-life product Disney Infinity in May 2016 as it sought a new direction.
    • The company is experimenting with new genres and new platforms including Steam, Laughlin says.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:06 PM | 12 Comments
  • AMZN

    Amazon hiring HIPAA Compliance Lead for "new initiative"

    • Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) is hiring a health policy expert for a “new initiative,” according to a job posting.  
    • Job description: “The HIPAA Compliance Lead is an experienced HIPAA professional who will own and operate the security and compliance elements of a new initiative. You will work alongside product managers, software developers, bizdev, and legal teams to ensure that our services are in compliance with HIPAA security and privacy requirements.”
    • The listing seeks someone who can work with outside partners and has experience with healthcare regulation.
    • The hire could go towards Amazon’s plans of selling pharmaceuticals and/or towards making Alexa HIPAA compliant.
    • Amazon shares are down 0.2%.   
    • Previously: BMO Capital raises Amazon to new Street-high target on ad potential (Jan. 16)
    • Previously: Amazon Fresh keeps the pressure on Blue Apron (Jan. 16)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM | 11 Comments
  • KBR

    KBR JV wins two FEED contracts from Azerbaijan for production platform

    • KBR (KBR -2.5%) says its joint venture with Azerbaijan's SOCAR was awarded two front-end engineering design contracts for a new Caspian Sea production platform with drilling quarters.
    • KBR says the contracts mark the fourth and fifth awards to the SOCAR-KBR JV since its inception in mid-2015 to help further Azerbaijan's ambition for creating a world-class Azerbaijan based engineering company.
    • The Azeri Central East platform will be located in the Azeri-Chirag-Gunashli field in the Azerbaijan sector of the Caspian Sea.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2.55 pm (1/16/18)

    • Gainers: MYSZ +26%. NCTY +20%. NNDM +13%. ELTK +11%. RTEC +6%.
    • Losers: WPCS -19%. DPW -18%. CCIH -12%. GDS -12%. RUBI -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM
  • UAA

    Another gloomy read on Under Armour

    • Another firm jumps into the Under Armour (UAA, UA) bear camp on a similar theme of expectations for lower EBITDA marks from the athletic apparel seller.
    • Canaccord Genuity's warning on Under Armour also includes a belief that the company may have to resort to a capital raise if margins don't improve.
    • Canaccord lowers its rating on UAA to Underperform from Neutral and assigns a price target of $8 on the stock that once traded over $50 (split-adjusted).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM | 19 Comments
  • LEA

    No spinoffs planned at Lear Corporation

    • Execs with Lear Corporation (LEA -1%) say the company isn't going to spin off business units like many of its peers in the auto supplier sector.
    • The strategy was disclosed during a presentation at the Deutsche Bank Global Auto Industry Conference in Detroit (webcast).
    • The execs also pointed to Lear's ability to grow market share in two separate industry segments (seating, e-systems) and maintain a balanced capita allocation strategy ($4.8B in M&A and business investment vs. $4.0B in dividends and share buybacks).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM
  • VALE

    Vale, Newmont downgraded at Deutsche Bank; steel outlook bullish

    • Vale (VALE -2.8%) and Newmont Mining (NEM +0.2%) are downgraded to Hold from Buy at Deutsche Bank, citing their rich valuations and the firm's belief that catalysts for both stocks are largely played out.
    • Meanwhile, Deutsche Bank raises its 2018 and 2019 forecasts for most commodities, particularly for steel (hot-rolled coil up 10% in 2018 to $685/ton) and base metals (copper up 10% to $3.26/lb, aluminum up 9% to $1.03/lb in 2018), and is bullish on the entire steel space, with a preference for Steel Dynamics (STLD -1%), US Steel (X), Reliance Steel (RS +0.8%) and Nucor (NUE -0.3%).
    • But the firm also reiterates a Sell rating on Freeport McMoran (FCX -2.5%) despite the positive environment for copper prices, citing concerns about valuation and delays to resolving problems with the Grasberg mine.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM | 20 Comments
  • TGNA

    TEGNA and Sony Pictures Television announce distribution partnership

    • TEGNA (TGNA +1.4%) and Sony Pictures Television have entered into an exclusive, multi-year distribution agreement for TEGNA’s programming in the United States and internationally.
    • Under the terms of the deal, SPT will distribute all TEGNA owned first-run programming, including the new series “Daily Blast Live”, as well as future development.
    • “It’s a one-of-a-kind agreement, where TEGNA and Sony Pictures Television each bring distinct strengths to the new partnership,” said Robert Sullivan, SVP for programming, TEGNA. “With ‘Daily Blast Live’ and other programs in our creative pipeline, together with Sony’s expertise in the three key areas of sales, development and distribution, we look forward to expanding our list of available content for TEGNA stations and beyond.”
     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM
  • HRB

    H&R Block higher after tipping Walmart deal

    • H&R Block (HRB +1.2%) breaks higher after the company announces that it will be the "exclusive DIY" desktop tax software provider at Walmart stores.
    • "In addition to better prices, the value H&R Block can offer Walmart shoppers with our support features, such as free in-person audit representation and unlimited free tax advice, is among the many reasons we are so pleased to expand our partnership with Walmart this year," says H&R digital manager Heather Watts.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM
  • WDAY

    Workday acquires enterprise AI company

    • Workday (NYSE:WDAY) acquires SkipFlag, which makes an AI knowledge base built from a company’s internal communications. No terms were disclosed.
    • ”SkipFlag uses deep learning to help people make sense of mountains of data across multiple applications used by today’s workforce. With SkipFlag, we welcome an incredible team of engineers and data scientists along with an innovative technology that we intend to fold into our core platform.
    • SkipFlag joining Workday is yet another step in our journey to continually invest in areas such as machine learning, advanced search, and natural language processing — further powering our products to be faster and more intelligent so our customers can access even better insights when and where they need,” writes Workday CTO Joe Korngiebel in the announcement blog post. 
    • Workday shares are down 2.5%.
    • Previously: Workday +3.7% on analyst upgrade, new Street-high target (Jan. 10)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM | 5 Comments
  • GBTC

    Hodlers face test as cryptocurrency plunges deepens

    • Bitcoin was recently down 25% and quoted below $11K on some exchanges. Ethereum and Litecoin are showing similar declines.
    • Ripple is down 31.5% to $1.25. About ten days ago, it had touched a high of $3.81 and briefly made its CEO wealthier than Mark Zuckerberg. Five weeks ago, it could be had for $0.25.
    • Crypto veterans have seen this movie before, and Bitcoin's 45% plunge from a high hit one month ago could look like nothing more than a blip on a chart. New speculators who rushed in at $15K or higher may feel differently.
    • In some encouraging news for cryptocurrency fans, Dallas Mavericks owner Mark Cuban says the team next season will begin accepting Bitcoin, Ether and maybe other coins as payment for tickets.
    • Related tickers: OTCQX:GBTC, COIN, RIOT, OSTK, SSC-OLD, MARA, UEPS, OTC:BITCF, XNET, GROW, OTCPK:BTSC, OTCQB:BTCS, OTCQB:MGTI, OTCPK:BTLLF SRAX, OTCPK:GAHC, OTC:UBIA, OTC:ARSC, OTCPK:USTC, PRELF, OTCPK:BLKCF, OTC:CRCW, COINB, OTCPK:LFIN
     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM | 180 Comments

  • Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm (1/16/2018)

    • Gainers: RCON +116%. SSRM +12%. CGG-OLD +11%. SDPI +10%. BXE +8%.
    • Losers: DELT -9%. IO -8%. SND -8%. SAEX -8%. MVO -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM | 11 Comments

  • Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM

    • Gainers: HAWK +23%. IHT +12%.IIPR +9%. FANH +8%. ICBK +8%.
    • Losers: FPAY -14%. SIEB -12%. WHLR -10%. JTPY -8%. GROW -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • CPB

    Campbell Soup rallies after Citi callout

    • Campbell Soup (CPB +2.9%) is called one of the cheapest stocks in the food sector by Citi.
    • Analyst David Driscoll observes that Campbell currently trades at ~13X the 2019 EPS projection, lower than the 17X trading multiple average over the last 15 years.
    • Campbell Soup was down 18% in 2017 vs. +0.64% for the broad packaged food sector.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM | 1 Comment
  • WSM

    Goldman Sachs cools off on Williams-Sonoma

    • Williams-Sonoma (WSM -2.2%) drifts lower after Goldman Sachs lowers the retailer to a Neutral rating from Buy.
    • The firm points to valuation on Williams-Sonoma after its run to +$55 and voices concerns on the impact of tax reform on high-end housing.
    • Williams-Sonoma isn't due to report Q4 earnings until March.
    • Sources: CNBC and Nasdaq.com
     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM | 5 Comments
  • TTWO

    KeyBanc: 'GTA' update should provide strong holiday for Take-Two

    • Take-Two Interactive (TTWO -1.8%) is set to report strong holidays despite lacking a blockbuster release, KeyBanc says in a note.
    • That's in part due to a "significant" free update to cash cow Grand Theft Auto Online, which Take-Two unit Rockstar Games noted attracted a record number of players (which likely led to more spending on in-game goods, KeyBanc says).
    • KeyBanc now expects EPS of $1.22 for the holiday quarter; Street expectations according to Capital IQ are $0.96 in EPS, on revenues that hit $659.2M.
    • Source: Dow Jones
     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM | 1 Comment
  • CEL

    Cellcom controlling shareholder mulls credit arrangement

    • Cellcom Israel (NYSE:CEL) is off 8.3% in U.S. trading after noting its indirect controlling shareholder is looking at outlining a proposal for a creditors arrangement in Eurocom Communications and/or companies in its group.
    • Discount Investment Corp. says such a proposal, if it is eventually approved and implemented, could have implications on its Cellcom holdings.
    • The move today has trimmed gains the stock since hitting a 52-week low last Aug. 21 (it's now up 12.1% since).
     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM
  • HMY

    Harmony Gold on track to meet 2017 output guidance after solid six months

    • Harmony Gold (HMY -3.6%) says it is on track to meet annual production guidance of 1.1M oz. after producing more than 550K oz. in H2 2017.
    • HMY says H2 gold production rose 3%-5% compared to H1, with gold production from its South African operations rising 9%-11% vs. the previous six months.
    • HMY also says its Hidden Valley mine is on track to deliver as forecast in FY 2018, after an infrastructure upgrade was completed and processing of ore started two weeks ahead of schedule.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM | 13 Comments
  • APVO

    Aptevo Therapeutics down 27%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Aptevo Therapeutics (APVO -27.3%) slumps on a 4x spike in volume on no particular news.
    • The company has one commercial product, IXINITY [coagulation factor IX (recombinant)], for hemophilia B.
    • It has two candidates in the clinic: Phase 1b-stage otlertuzumab for chronic lymphocytic leukemia and Phase 1-stage APVO414 for castration-resistant prostate cancer.
    • A correction is not entirely unexpected considering the stock's four-fold runup since late August.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM | 7 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers (1/16/2018)

    • Gainers: RCON +99%. OTC:BEBE +40%. MYSZ +35%. NCTY +32%. NEWA +26%. NHTC +23%. HAWK +23%. ELTK +17%. SRNE +17%. NFEC +17%.
    • Losers: EIGR -47%. APVO -28%. ZAGG -16%. SCOR -15%. WPCS -15%. DPW -14%. TNDM -13%. HTZ -13%. RIOT -13%. MARA -13%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM | 4 Comments
  • AG

    First Majestic Silver sees 2017 production in-line with guidance, 2018 higher

    • First Majestic Silver (AG +5.9%) is higher after reporting 2017 production reached 16.2M equiv. oz. of silver, a 13% Y/Y decline but in line with the company's guidance of 15.7M-16.6M silver equiv. oz.
    • Annual silver production of 9.7M oz. was 3% below AG's guidance of 10M-10.6M oz., including Q4 silver production of 2.3M oz. and silver equiv. output of 4.1M oz.
    • AG anticipates 2018 silver production of 10.6M-11.8M oz., a 15% Y/Y increase based on the midpoint of its guidance range, primarily due to higher silver grades from caving and the start-up of the new roasting circuit at La Encantada; total 2018 silver equiv. production is forecast at 15.7M-17.5M oz., a slight increase from 2017, mostly due to higher silver production at La Encantada offset by less gold by-product credits at Santa Elena.
    • AG also projects 2018 all-in sustained costs of $15.21-$16.56 per payable silver oz.

  • BHP

    Base metals miners slip as dollar steadies

    • While most stock market segments enjoy sturdy gains, big miners are lower as copper and other base metals sink in "a sea of red” due to softening Chinese industrial activity ahead of the country’s New Year holiday.
    • Copper has plunged as much as 2.2% in London while nickel tumbled nearly 4% for their biggest declines since early December, after which they went on to surge 10% and 20%, respectively.
    • A steadier U.S. dollar also ended the euro’s four-day hot-streak; a weaker dollar had helped the sector by making raw materials cheaper for buyers holding other currencies.
    • "China’s fixed asset investment is expected to continue to slow, so that slowdown in China will weigh on select commodities in 2018,” says Atul Lele, chief investment officer at Deltec International Group, but other analysts think prices will continue to rise, supported by a favorable global economic backdrop and supply disruptions.
    • BHP -2%, RIO -2.5%, VALE -2.9%, FCX -1.1%, TECK -2.3%, OTC:ANFGF -1.7%.

  • SCOR

    comScore signs expansion agreement with Turner

    • comScore (SCOR -17.5%) announced an agreement with Turner, expanding its existing (VOD & Core Digital Media Matrix Service) relationship to include linear TV ratings measurement and comScore's Advanced Audiences™ segmentation.
    • With this expansion, the company can combine household-level TV tuning information with consumer behavior data from third-party segmentation providers to go beyond traditional age/gender demographics. This allows potential advertisers to better target more relevant audiences, ensuring ads are being seen by the consumers they want to reach.
    • comScore's SVP of National Television Sales, Carol Hinnant: "Turner is one of the biggest players in broadcasting, so this agreement only further highlights the value of advanced audiences. It's good for advertisers, it's good for networks, and it's good for the industry."

  • GOOG

    Google building three underwater cables to expand Cloud, compete with Amazon

    • Google (GOOG, GOOGL) plans to build three underwater cables by next year to help Google Cloud reach new regions.
    • One cable will connect Chile to Los Angeles, the second (done in conjunction with Facebook) connects the U.S. to Denmark and Ireland, and the third runs from Hong Kong to Guam. 
    • Netherlands and Montreal regions will open in 1Q18 with L.A., Finland, and Hong Kong to follow. 
    • Google now has 11 direct investments in cables, which help maintain service in an area in case of server malfunctions. 
    • Market share: Google Cloud held a 6% cloud services market share in Q3, according to Canalys research, The share represented a 76% growth on the year, but Google still took third place to Amazon Web Services (32% share) and Microsoft Azure (14% share.) 
    • Alphabet Class A shares are up 0.7% and Class C shares are up 0.9%.

    Tenax to launch mid-stage study of levosimendan in PH-HFpEF in Q3; investors unmoved, shares down 17%

    • Acting on advice from experts in the field, Tenax Therapeutics (TENX -16.5%) announces that it plans to initiate a Phase 2 clinical trial in Q3 assessing lead candidate levosimendan in patients with pulmonary hypertension associated with heart failure and preserved ejection fraction (PH-HFpEF), a condition with a poor prognosis that affects ~1.5M Americans and for which no effective treatments are available.
